intro: Notoseris, commonly known as the goldenrod family member, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Asteraceae family. These plants are typically herbaceous and are found in various habitats across the Northern Hemisphere. Notoseris species are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. They often have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. These plants are known for their ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils and are often found in open fields and along roadsides.
